text.0: flow on to indra soma carefully effused let sickness stay afar together with the fiends.
text.1: let not the doubletongued delight them with thy juice here be thy flowing drops laden with opulence.
text.2: o pavamana urge us forward in the fight thou art the vigour of the gods the wellloved drink.
text.3: smite thou our enemies who raise the shout of joy indra drink soma juice and drive away our foes.
text.4: unharmed best cheerer thou o indu flowest on thou even thou thyself art indras noblest food.
text.5: full many a wise man lifts to thee the song of praise and hails thee with a kiss as sovran of this world.
text.6: wondrous with hundred streams hymned in a thousand songs indu pours out for indra his delightrul meath.
text.7: winning us land and waters flow thou hitherward rainer of bounties soma make broad way for us.
text.8: roaring within the beaker thou art balmed with milk thou passest through the fleecy filter all at once.
text.9: carefully cleansed and decked like a prizewinning steed o soma thou hast flowed down within indras throat.
text.10: flow onward sweet of flavour for the heavenly race for indra sweet whose name is easily invoked.
text.11: flow sweet for mitra varuṇa and vāyu rich in meath inviolable for bṛhaspati.
text.12: ten rapid fingers deck the courser in the jar with hymns the holy singers send their voices forth.
text.13: the filtering juices hasten to their eulogy the drops that gladden find their way to indras heart.
text.14: while thou art purified pour on us hero strength great farextended shelter spacious pasturage.
text.15: let no oppression master this our holy work may we o indu gain all opulence through thee.
text.16: the steer who sees afar hath risen above the sky the sage hath caused the lights of heaven to give their shine.
text.17: the king is passing through the filter with a roar they drain the milk of heaven from him who looks on men.
text.18: high in the vault of heaven unceasing honeytongued the loving ones drain out the mountainhaunting steer.
text.19: the drop that hath grown great in waters in the lake meathrich in the streams wave and in the cleansing sieve.
text.20: the loving ones besought with many voices the eagle who had flown away to heaven.
text.21: hymns kiss the youngling worthy of laudation resting on earth the bird of golden colour.
text.22: high to heavens vault hath the gandharva risen beholding all his varied forms and figures.
text.23: his ray hath shone abroad with gleaming splendour pure he hath lighted both the worlds the parents.
